lexUnit.name: smack.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to strike with a sharp slap

sentence.text: A large hand smacked into his mouth and although he bit at it the thumb was forced like a gag between his teeth .
Evans 's heavy hand smacked down on the small man 's shoulder .
Palms were spat upon and smacked together .
Latex smacked lustily against solid flesh .
It smacked savagely into the man 's face , flattening his nose .
What was more painful were Kate 's fists smacking into his stomach , blow after blow .
His head smacked firmly and noisily on the low metal ceiling of the tank , threatening to send him spinning back into unconsciousness almost straight away .
It swerved , dipped and smacked the bar .
When her red boots stepped on to the pavement the shock which smacked into her was conveniently attributed to the cold .
If Tim Sherwood 's long range blast in the 73rd minute had gone in instead of smacking against the bar , it would have been all up for United .
A Prussian musket bullet fluttered overhead to smack against a house wall that was smothered with posters advertising a fair , which was to be held on the feast day of St Peter and Paul .
Now the little girl sits at a small table in the cellar , the playing cards , Ludo and Monopoly set aside , as snipers ' bullets smack into the building and an grenades drop into the street .

Jimmy and Cardiff recoiled , but Rohmer remained calmly where he was , as the impact flung Frye 's sundered head forward , his shattered face smacking into the wall â€¦ and rapidly becoming absorbed there .
No matter how much Signe varied the speed , Harvey 's hand was up there providing a wall against which her hand smacked , until he snatched his hand away and she toppled into his arms .
